snippet: Now that Anthony D. Weiner’s campaign has imploded, Bill de Blasio is drawing new energy and voter interest to a candidacy that presents a sweeping rejection of what New York City has become.
abstract: Bill de Blasio, public advocate running for mayor, is drawing new energy and voter interest, now that Anthony D Weiner's campaign has imploded;  his platform presents the most sweeping rejection of what New York City has become in past decade; in a city that is endlessly congratulating itself for its modern renaissance, day on the campaign trail with de Blasio is a reminder of unaddressed grievances and glaring disparities.
lead_paragraph: Now that Anthony D. Weiner’s campaign has imploded, Bill de Blasio is drawing new energy and voter interest to a candidacy that presents a sweeping rejection of what New York City has become.

headline.main: De Blasio Asks City to Address Its Inequalities
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Asks City to Address Its Inequalities
